reviews.text: Making a sincere summer blockbuster that’s one of Disney’s major franchise machines is no simple task, and yet here we are with a group of a-holes that we truly care about. It’s been a wild ride, but they managed to pull it off once more with feeling.
reviews.author: Aaron Neuwirth

reviews.text: A bursting-at-the-seams adventure that, minor missteps aside, reminds viewers why this ragtag crew remains one of the MCU’s highlights.
reviews.author: Nick Schager

reviews.text: Even though the plot has a bit too much going on, some of the humor feels stale, and Adam Warlock was woefully underused, the cast’s incredible chemistry and James Gunn’s soulful style remain unlike anything else in the MCU.
reviews.author: Joshua Yehl

reviews.text: “Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3” is an overall fun, exciting and emotional ending to what has been a consistently delightful trilogy within the MCU.
reviews.author: Lauren LaMagna

reviews.text: Overlong, yes, and finally reaching for an importance and emotional closure (perhaps inspired by Gunn’s own emotional corporate redemption) that it doesn’t quite encompass... But it’s still spectacular, spirited and often funny.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: Gunn’s obvious love for these characters has been the trilogy’s consistent and undeniable saving grace. And he notably doesn’t sell out that love as he brings those characters all to a conclusion.
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: A boisterous and often emotional sequel that feels very much like a true conclusion.
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: An undeniably emotional experience that highlights James Gunn's strengths as a storyteller, and while it suffers from all the same shortcomings as other MCU fare, it sends the series out on a high note.
reviews.author: Patrick Cavanaugh

reviews.text: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 mixes Gunn's usual wacky action and laugh-out-loud humor with a grounded, emotional story to create something special.
reviews.author: Molly Freeman

reviews.text: This is how you do a trilogy. It's the perfect ending. And the perfect new beginning. Every Guardian is allowed to complete their arc in a way that feels meaningful and impactful. James Gunn has done it again.
reviews.author: Tessa Smith

reviews.text: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is, in some ways, the strongest of its trilogy, but it suffers from being too much.
reviews.author: Nicole Ackman

reviews.text: [Gunn has] created a movie as audacious and surprising as the first one, but in newer, more confident and mature ways. Like the original it simultaneously makes you laugh, makes you cry, and makes you cheer. Did I mention crying?
reviews.author: Germain Lussier

reviews.text: This edition largely succeeds like the other ones, thanks to the chemistry of the main ensemble, who have grown into their characters with relaxed ease. The interplay among them is frequently delightful.
reviews.author: Frank Scheck

reviews.text: A big, silly and disarmingly big-hearted film which makes the most of what made this film series one of the most loved in the franchise. A fond and fantastic farewell.
reviews.author: Linda Marric

reviews.text: It’s still a funny movie with some cool action scenes and a lot of nonsense going on, all glued together by this really powerful emotional core.
reviews.author: Mike Ryan

reviews.text: James Gunn lets his core cast grow and evolve, finding a fitting ending to his trilogy that may not appeal to everyone, but feels as honest as anything Marvel Studios has ever released.
reviews.author: Evan Dossey

reviews.text: It definitely feels like a Guardians movie should - an overall emotional farewell. But Gunn turned up the volume the next level - and not necessarily in a good way. More like on deaf ears.
reviews.author: Christie Cronan

reviews.text: An uneven, sporadically emotional conclusion to the trilogy.
reviews.author: Chris Evangelista

reviews.text: Guardians of the Galaxy is a knockout, an impeccable send-off. It’s everything you’d want from such a film; emotional, awe-inspiring, funny and surprisingly, life-affirming
reviews.author: Maria Lattila

reviews.text: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 isn’t just the ideal sendoff for this group, it’s the best MCU film in years, and a reminder of how much fun and moving the Marvel Cinematic Universe can actually be after film-after-film of recent disappointments.
reviews.author: Ross Bonaime

reviews.text: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 proves to be a brilliant end to a brilliant trilogy, which now can be considered as the MCU's strongest.
reviews.author: Ian Sandwell

reviews.text: Third time’s a charm for everyone’s favourite band of cosmic reprobates as the Guardians return for a threequel that’s pleasingly focused and has a dark and demented heart.
reviews.author: Kevin Maher

reviews.text: Rocket is the heart of Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3, and the Guardians of the Galaxy are the heart and soul of the MCU. James Gunn has finished the trilogy on his terms, surprising and prioritizing emotion over everything else. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jesus Agudo

reviews.text: Despite its issues — including a hyperactive third act, groan-worthy humor in spurts, and a few too many indulgent look-cool-for-the-camera moments — Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is far and away the best Marvel movie since Avengers: Endgame.
reviews.author: Jon Negroni

reviews.text: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is a heartfelt and earnest conclusion to the trilogy. While some of James Gunn’s writing can be hit-or-miss, Vol.3 delivers on an emotionally high-stakes story that keeps you invested and entertained throughout.
reviews.author: Sheraz Farooqi

reviews.text: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is an emotional goodbye to friends from James Gunn that brought me to tears on more than one occasion.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: The film undermines its initial sense of intimacy and momentum with a stop-and-start story structure that by and large exists to make as much room as possible for its characters’ banter.
reviews.author: Greg Nussen

reviews.text: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is an emotional, action-packed, ear-pleasing space opera that hits all the right beats. The Guardians have never looked this good.
reviews.author: Matt Rodriguez

synopsis: In Marvel Studios "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3" our beloved band of misfits are looking a bit different these days. Peter Quill, still reeling from the loss of Gamora, must rally his team around him to defend the universe along with protecting one of their own. A mission that, if not completed successfully, could quite possibly lead to the end of the Guardians as we know them.
